intro: Gyranthera, commonly known as the mountain devil, is a genus of flowering plants native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plants are shrubs or small trees, often characterized by their rough, fissured bark and aromatic leaves. They produce small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in spring or summer. Gyranthera species are adapted to dry, sandy soils and are often found in heathlands and coastal areas.
